results.title: Election year: electing Australia's federal parliament
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In showing the conduct of a federal election this film shows how electoral boundaries are fixed, how candidates for election are selected by the political parties and also how votes are counted in elections for both the senate and the representatives
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Cohen, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: El nino
results.creator_credit: Peter Sellars, BBC, France 3, LGM, RM Associates and Theatre Musical be Paris-Chatelet
results.brief_description: A modern opera by John Adams, this is the world premier production of “El nino”, staged at the Theatre Musical be Paris-Chatelet, in 2000. Cast consists of: libretto, John Adams, Peter Sellars; soprano, Dawn Upshaw; mezzo-soprano, Lorraine Hunt Lieberson; baritone, Willard White; theatre of voices, Daniel Bubeck, Brian Cummings and Steven Rickards; performed by the Deutsches Symphonie Orchestre Berlin; conducted by Kent Nagano; dancers, Daniela Graca, Nora Kimball and Michael Shumacher. American minimalist composer John Adams represents the Christmas story, in light of the dawn of a new millennium, by interpreting the story described and prophesied in the New Testament of the Bible, as translated by American Richard Latimore. Adams has fragmented this text, added Old English and utilised the Apocrypha, while focusing on the work of female Latin American poets. Adams’ desire is to depict the birth of Christ simultaneously from several different, largely female, points of view. As the singers and dancers perform the work, a video track, created by Peter Sellars and Yreina D. Cervantez, is displayed as a backdrop, poignantly remarking upon the meagre existence of Hispanic Americans who live in the desert area near Los Angeles, between airport and beach. A stunningly original contemporary work, impressively staged and executed.

results.title: Egypte
results.creator_credit: Al Razutis, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Time-lapse photography, combined with chanted music, gives an impressionistic and highly moving view of the great monuments of Egypt where art and civilisation once flowered some 5,000 years ago

results.title: Egypt and Turkey
results.brief_description: Visit Egypt ‘the gift of the Nile” with a recorded history of more than five thousand years and experience the antiquities of Egypt such as the Sphinx and Great Pyramid in Giza. Travel to Cairo with its contrast of most modern city in the Middle East, but also mirror to an ancient past in bazaars, antiquities and museums. Visit also Alexandria once ruled by Alexander the Great and Cleopatra. In Turkey, visit Istanbul and the Turquoise Coast. Istanbul spans two continents and has been the capital of three empires: Byzantine, Holy Roman and Ottoman. Walk through the city’s old sector to see the monuments of these cultures.

results.title: Egghead's robot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Milo Lewis, Cecil Musk and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-alike robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G

results.title: Effective resumes: resumes for maximum impact
results.creator_credit: Robert Richardson Jr, Susan Richardson and Riverside Productions
results.brief_description: This American video addresses the need for every job seeker (in particular young people), to have a resume and methods for laying it out, presentation and content. It presents tips for achieving an edge over other applicants.

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Catherine South, Janet McLeod and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine South, Janet McLeod and Women’s Program of the AFC

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.

results.title: Edna Ryan: a political life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
Born in 1904, working class politics surrounded Edna Ryan as she grew up in New South Wales. As a young adult she worked for the newly formed Communist Party until she was expelled. As a socialist in wartime she eventually found a new home in the Australian Labor Party. As a feminist, she became active in the industrial courts, in 1958 she became the first woman Deputy Mayor of NSW and played a significant role in 1974 in the fight for equal pay for women.
